titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Sallie Arnold papers, 1864-1871
titlestmt.author: Processed by: Rubenstein Staff; EAD finding aid derived from MARC record using marc2ead_sectionA.xsl

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid derived from MARC record via marc2ead_sectionA.xsl, 2017

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

did.abstract: Collection consists, for the most part, of letters written to Sallie (Umstott) Arnold between 1864 and 1866 by Union soldiers and friends. The correspondence is mostly personal. There is also a description of a train trip from McConnellsburg, Pennsylvania, to Peoria City, Illinois, in 1866, and a description of a Dunkard camp meeting, also in 1866.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.p: Sallie Arnold Papers, 1864-1871, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.p: This finding aid was derived from a MARC record using a crosswalk defined in marc2ead_section.xsl. The finding aid was generated as part of a larger project to digitize several thousand small collections housed in Section A, January 2017.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Collection consists, for the most part, of letters written to Sallie (Umstott) Arnold between 1864 and 1866 by Union soldiers and friends. The correspondence is mostly personal. There is also a description of a train trip from McConnellsburg, Pennsylvania, to Peoria City, Illinois, in 1866, and a description of a Dunkard camp meeting, also in 1866.
